content.xhtml:p: PLC programming fill tank and discharge tank. First is the start stop control circuit.
Start Pumps if the bottom and top level are both less than 900 then start filling the top tank by 200 and start discharging the bottom tank by 200.
When Top level reaches 900. Start discharging the top valve by 200 and filling the bottom valve by 200. Both top fill and bottom discharge vlaves are 0.
When the bottom tank reaches 900. Start discharging the bottom valve by 200 and filling the top valve by 200. Set the top discharge and bottom fill to 0
Set the Top of tank equal to the top of the level and set the bottom of the tank equal to the bottom of the level. This is for display purposes only in factory IO.
For HMI purposes determine if the bottom valve is open if Bottom Discharge valve is greater 0
For HMI purposes and counting the amount the tank fills. when Top discharge vale is greater than zero count up and show top valve open.
